column5: are there any campsites or areas where we could camp out around lac seul, me and my friends are relatively poor since we are university students and can not afford to pay for lodges

You can camp on Lac Seul only if you are a resident of Canada, otherwise rules apply to how far you must be away from Lac Seul. Check with MNR for exact rules. Used to be able to camp in Broad and Sunlight which was accessible to Seul by stream. No longer.

My buddies camped at alodge up in Red Lake. It was off season so the camp was not open. They got permission from the fishing lodge owner to stay on the grounds. Also if you go to the Local town Ministry/Gov't. you should be able to obtain some sort of permit to camp in the area you want to go. I would try and contact them before heading up the you know eh?
There are several camps that have camping availabe at a resonable price. check out Ear Falls, Ontario web site or check with Sunset country out of Kenora
Take a look at http://www.justfishontario.com/lac_seul.htm, you will find it there. I would call the MNR office in Sioux Lookout, they can give you good info.
